name: CH 134.620 - 1.0 PRE-CONSTRUCTION WORKS
template name: Kiwirail - North Auckland Line Recovery - CH 134.620 - 01.0 PRE-CONSTRUCTION WORKS

name: DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: Awaiting IFC Drawings
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Ensure latest revision is being used
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to works, updated accordingly based on formal correspondence
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Controlled IFC drawings being used – Checkpoint on QA
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – Detailed Design Report - NAL CH 134.620km: Section 6

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The contractor is responsible for protecting earthworks and erosion control measures, and must develop a site-specific Environmental Control Plan (ESCP) that KiwiRail must review before construction begins.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Contractor to ensure effective erosion and sedimentation control measures shall be installed and maintained in accordance with Auckland Council Resource Consent Requirements, and the ESCP.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Before construction begins
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: ESCP Documentation, Photos, Daily and Weekly Audits
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO – Detailed Design Report - NAL CH 134.620km: Section 7
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: An ecologist from KiwiRail must be consulted and on-site to assess the site before and during the removal of vegetation and trees.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The contractor to collaborate with the appointed ecologist from KiwiRail and adhere to the proposed controls.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of works
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: RFI for Clarity and record purposes
CH 134.620 - 2.0 SITE CLEARANCE
template name: Kiwirail - North Auckland Line Recovery - CH 134.620 - 02.0 SITE CLEARANCE

name: DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 2

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The Contractor must set out the working area shown on the Construction Drawings, under observation by ENGEO. The clearing extent on the plans must be agreed on-site after pegging the earthworks area. Clearing will not begin until the agreed extent is established through pegging or paint marking by the Contractor and ENGEO. Adequate silt control measures must be installed.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Agreed extent is established by the Contractor and ENGEO.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: After setting out of clearing area and prior to all clearing
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation of ENGEO’s approval
CH 134.620 - 3.0 EARTHWORKS
template name: Kiwirail - North Auckland Line Recovery - CH 134.620 - 03.0 EARTHWORKS

name: 3.01 - Protection of Earthworks and Erosion and Sediment Control
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 3.1
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The contractor is responsible for protecting earthworks, implementing erosion and sediment control measures, and conducting surface drainage within work limits.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The KiwiRail Erosion and Sediment Control Management Plan and associated drawings must be followed for the installation and maintenance of effective erosion and sedimentation control measures.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of any earthworks
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Photos, Daily and Weekly audits
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 3.2

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The Earthworks Quality Plan must include a mass haul diagram detailing imported materials and their locations for placement. All imported fill must be certified as free of contamination at source, and reported to ENGEO and the Principal before importation.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Approval of imported fill material by ENGEO and or the Principal.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to fill being imported to site
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Material report & certification, Written Confirmation of ENGEO/Principal’s approval
CH 134.620 - 4.0 EARTHWORKS - EXCAVATION
template name: Kiwirail - North Auckland Line Recovery - CH 134.620 - 04.0 EARTHWORKS - EXCAVATION

name: DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 4.1
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: All unsuitable material removed prior to filling
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Inspection and approval by ENGEO that all unsuitable material removed prior to filling
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Inspection prior to filling
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Photos, Written Instruction/Confirmation from ENGEO
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 4.2

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: To ensure proper filling, any sliding slope with a steeper slope of six horizontal to one vertical (ten degrees) must be benched before filling, while slopes shallower require scarification. ENGEO should assess cut and fill slopes for additional recommendations.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Cut and Fill Slopes to be assessed by ENGEO. Any additional recommendations to be implemented when required.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Inspection of all cut and fill slopes
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Photos, Written Instruction/Confirmation from ENGEO
CH 134.620 - 5.0 EARTHWORKS - FILL
template name: Kiwirail - North Auckland Line Recovery - CH 134.620 - 05.0 EARTHWORKS - FILL

name: DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 5.1
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Site-won materials used as engineered fill must be free of topsoil, organic matter, and rubbish, with a maximum particle size of 100mm, and mixed or crushed efficiently.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Material compacted to achieve like for like with surrounding soils, and/or shear vanes of > SU=100 kPa and 12% air voids. Standard of compaction may be re-assessed and specified onsite by ENGEO if applicable.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Frequency to be specified by ENGEO
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Test Results, Written Confirmation of ENGEO’s approval
5.02 - Imported Hardfill for the Toe Buttress (if required)
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 5.2

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Hardfill (imported) for the toe buttress (if required) shall comprise a graded, unweathered, durable, crushed rock product (AP65) approved by ENGEO, with a grading suitable for compaction
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Hardfill product approved by ENGEO
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to hardfill being imported to site
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Material Test Results/Certs, Confirmation of ENGEO’s approval
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 5.2
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Hardfill placed and compacted in 200mm lifts and tested.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Hardfill compacted to 95% of the Maximum Dry Density (MDD)
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: One test per 500m3 of hardfill placed with not less than one test per 500mm lift of filling for each fill area
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: MDD Results, QA Checksheet(s)
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 8

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The contractor is required to provide ENGEO with as-built information for a MSQA Geotechnical Completion Report, including surveying items before filling, which should form a hold point in the construction sequence.
ENGEO to receive as-built drawings for:
○ The depth of filling placed including all benching, undercuts, and shear keys.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As-built approved by ENGEO
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Items to be surveyed before filling. As-builts to be provided upon completion of works
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: As-builts
CH 134.620 - 6.0 COUNTERFORT DRAINAGE
template name: Kiwirail - North Auckland Line Recovery - CH 134.620 - 06.0 COUNTERFORT DRAINAGE

name: 6.01 - Review of Drainage and Fill Materials
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 6.2, ENGEO – NAL 134.620km: Drawing 4
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Drainage and fill materials installed within the site to the detail provided in the design drawings.
○ Perforated Subsoil Drain ((Megaflo 170, Novaflo Hi-way grade 150mm or approved equiv)
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Drainage and fill materials approved by the Geotechnical Engineer.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to installation of drainage and fill materials
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Material specs/certs, Written Confirmation/Approval from Geotechnical Engineer
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 6.2
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Counterfort drains installed within the site in the locations provided in the design drawings
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Locations agreed between the Contractor and Geotechnical Engineer
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to commencement of counterfort drain works
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation/Approval from Geotechnical Engineer, Photos, QA Checksheet(s)
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 6.2, ENGEO – NAL 134.620km: Drawing 4
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Installation should be undertaken in short sections (<5m lengths) and during period of dry weather
○ The Counterfort Drainage will consist of a 500mm wide trench, 2m deep, tapering up to outlet into the reformed swale adjacent to the rail formation.
○ The counterfort drainage should be lined with Geotextile, have a perforated subsoil drain at the base, and be backfilled with angular, no fines drainage rock.
○ The Geotextile should fully wrap the drainage material, and the excavation should have a minimum cohesive soil cap of 0.5m thick
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Counterfort drains installed as per the drawings and specifications.
○ Installation approved by the Geotechnical Engineer
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Prior to filling
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation/Approval from Geotechnical Engineer, Photos, QA Checksheet(s)
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 6.2
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The invert level of outlets must be aligned with the design drawings' levels to ensure proper drainage throughout the design life.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Drains are operational and proved by the Geotechnical Engineer.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: For every section of drain installed
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation/Approval from Geotechnical Engineer, Photos, QA Checksheet(s)
6.05 - Observation of Flushing Point and Outlet
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 6.2
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: Flushing point and outlet to be observed
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Flushing point and outlet observed by the Geotechnical Engineer.
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: For every section of drain installed
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation/Approval from Geotechnical Engineer, Photos, QA Checksheet(s)
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 8

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: The contractor is required to provide ENGEO with as-built information for a MSQA Geotechnical Completion Report, including surveying items before filling, which should form a hold point in the construction sequence.
ENGEO to receive as-built drawings for:
○ The location and invert of all surface and sub-surface drainage
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: As-built approved by ENGEO
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: Upon completion of works and prior to any filling
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: As-builts

SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: ENGEO inspection of completed drainage and counterfort drainage
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: For every section of completed drainage works
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation of ENGEO’s approval, Photos, QA Checksheet(s)
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 7, ENGEO – NAL 134.620km: Drawing 4
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: ENGEO inspection of the finished surfaces prior to revegetation (may also be required for survey purposes as required by ENGEO)
○ Revegetation in accordance with Kiwirail Corridor Schedule (2023)
TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: For every section of finished surface prior to revegetation
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation of ENGEO’s approval, Photos, QA Checksheet(s)
DRAWING / SPECIFICATION REF.: ENGEO Technical Specification – NAL 134.620km: Section 7, ENGEO – NAL 134.620km: Drawing 4
SPECIFICATION DETAIL SUMMARY: ENGEO inspection of completed hydroseeding.

TEST SPEC AND FREQUENCY: For every section upon completion of hydroseeding
CONTROL TYPE I.E. CHECKSHEET / IANZ RECORDS: Written Confirmation of ENGEO’s approval, Photos
